Class Card

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Listable, java.io.Serializable
public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements Listable

Class Card holds attributes for suite, value and color can be used for creating card games. Can also represent a Joker.

See Also:
Pack, Serialized Form

setSuite

public void setSuite(char s)
              throws SuiteInvalidException
Sets/changes the Suite of the card and the colour to match. c = CLUB, d = DIAMOND, h = HEART, s = SPADE, J = JOKER. Either us these char's or the statics defined in this class.
Parameters:
char - s The suite code for the card.
Throws:
SuiteInvalidException - if the given character does not corrispond with any of the set suite codes.

getSuite

public char getSuite()
Returns the Suite code of the card. Check against the codes defined above.
Returns:
char The suite code for the card

getSuiteString

public java.lang.String getSuiteString()
Returns a String representation of the Suite.
Returns:
String the Name of the Suite

getColour

public char getColour()
Returns the colour code for this card. Check against the codes defined above.
Returns:
the colour of the card

isEqual

public boolean isEqual(Listable other)
This method is only invoked when this card is tested against another Listable Object which isn't a Card. Therefor will always return false.
Specified by:
isEqual in interface Listable
Returns:
true If the cards are the same value and suite.

isEqual

public boolean isEqual(Card other)
Tests to see if This card is equal in value and suite to the given Card. This replaces the isEqual in the Listable interface.
Parameters:
Card - other The Card to test against.
Returns:
true If the Cards have equal values of suite and value.

isEqual

public boolean isEqual(Listable other,
                       char att)
                throws java.lang.Exception
This uses a character switch to test equality of diffrent attributes of the card. For Instance if you wanted to see if the colours of two cards were equal the second veriable would be 'c'. Use 'c' to test colour, 's' for suite and 'v' for value.
Specified by:
isEqual in interface Listable
Parameters:
Card - the card to test this one against.
char - The attribute to test against.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the test code is invalid.

isEqual

public boolean isEqual(Card other,
                       char att)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Tests to see if this Card and the given card have the same value in the selected attribute. The character codes for selecting attributes are;
'c' for Colour, 's' for suite, 'v' for value.
NB. The code is case sensative.
Parameters:
Card - other The card to test against.
char - att The selection code.
Returns:
true if the Cards are equal in the selected attribute.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If the selected code does not do anything.

isLessThan

public boolean isLessThan(Card other)
Tests to see if the value of this card is less than the value of the other card.
Parameters:
Card - other The card to tst this one against.
Returns:
true If this card has a value less than the other Card.

public boolean isGreaterThan(Card other)

Card - other The Card to test this one against.

true If this card has a value greater than the other Card.
